lcn.p: The Dark Jedi are the ultimate in Jedi training gone-wrong. Sometimes someone becomes a Dark Jedi because they were of ill-will from the start - yet for some reason, they were not screened out and received Jedi training anyway. However, quite often, it is not like this at all - rather, it is a result of someone making a wrong-turn in their training and never getting back on the right track.

The Dark Jedi uses the dark emotions to access the Force - and thus cultivates these dark emotions so as to continue being able to do so. Sometimes this is even how the downward spiral to the Dark Jedi path begins.

While the true Jedi seeks unity with the Force, harmony with the Universe - the Dark Jedi seeks power and thinks of the Force largely as a means to that end. Sometimes this, too, can be the gateway to the Dark Jedi path when a Jedi in training refuses to accept one of the immutables of life.

Not all Dark Jedi are aware that the path that they are on is no longer the Jedi path. Many think that they have merely tempered the Jedi path with "reality". In truth, though, what they have mixed in is a one-sided and distorted extract from reality. They exaggerate the difficulty of the actual Jedi Path - and while that difficulty is in fact real, their elevation of that difficulty elevates it to the level of impossibility, or at least impracticality. That and/or they are way too dismissive of the other side of the equation - that being that while the true Jedi path is not always the most expedient way of doing things, there will be serious consequences of straying from the path because of this.
As Master Yoda said: "If you choose the quick and easy path as Vader did, you will become an agent of evil."

The Dark Jedi fancy themselves to be wiser than the authentic Jedi. Nonetheless, it is they who are the foolish ones. Seduced by the Dark Side of the Force, their variant on the Jedi path is stripped of all it's noble value.
